meanings.definition: An opinion or decision made before all the facts are known.
meanings.sent1: Her prejudgment about the new student turned out to be completely wrong.
meanings.sent2: Making a prejudgment without understanding the situation can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's prejudgment about the taste of the new food made her miss out on a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His prejudgment of the book based on its cover proved to be a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The prejudgment she had about the movie's ending was shattered when she watched it.

meanings.definition: The act of judging or deciding something before having all the necessary information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's prejudgment of the student's abilities affected how she graded the assignment.
meanings.sent2: It is important to avoid prejudgment when making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The prejudgment of the weather forecast led to unexpected outcomes for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His prejudgment of the situation caused unnecessary stress for everyone involved.
meanings.sent5: The prejudgment of the outcome made the game even more exciting to watch.
